one_reviews_text: Personally I've never had an issue with the app, and periodically return to it just for the experience. Not only is it educational, but the views and experience itself is absolutely stunning. Highly recommended.

I have all space vr programs and this was awesome, love the narrated documentary style experience. I don’t understand some people’s complaints, I mean if you want it to look really realistic, build a rocket and go into space, but likely your head would explode because well no man can build a ship to view this stuff and would likely fail and fall apart getting close to these objects,what do you expect? Play no man’s sky/everspace or elite dangerous if you want a game and interaction, be glad you are in a time where you can experience stuff like this, maybe you should go back in time and shovel horse crap for chicken eggs and only source of entertainment is watching plaque bodies be dumped on a meat wagon, for me it was more than enough and I’m picky. Great for kids too, instead of seeing videos and books in class they can experience space and it’s scale visually while learning. Can’t wait for more, good job.
review_feedback:
Thanks for your feedback: it made our day!
Feel free to email us to hop on our beta program with upcoming additional content: support at orbitalviews.com

one_reviews_text: Not responding, using a quest 2 connected by link cable to my pc, game just loads forever and on desktop just says not responding, very excited to experience it but won't work

This VR program provides amazing insight into distance in space and the incomprehensible vastness of this Universe we live in. It provides a wonderful visual model showing the eight planets revolving around the sun and gives you a fantastic sense of the relative size and speed each planet is traveling at.
review_feedback: Thanks for your feedback

one_reviews_text: Mesmerizing documentary that humbles you. I loved every experience of it. I had a problem with the sound over my headset however, thus the 4 stars otherwise its a must see for many people.
review_feedback: Thanks for your feedback! Feel free to contact us at support@orbitalviews.com regarding your sound problem.

review_title: Has never been able to launch
one_reviews_text: I couldnt work out the oculus maze of getting a refund within a day if a product doesnt work, so i guess im stuck with this thing... Just wont launch. Would appreciate some help, but i get the feeling it wont be forthcoming based on other reviews.
review_feedback: Hi DemonicDragon, let's get you out of the maze: you can email us at support@orbitalviews.com and we'll provide support and/or a key for a functional platform. All the best!

one_reviews_text: i can't start with an AMD 580 / 6800XT.  no updates for months...
review_feedback: Hi Locutus_oB: please send you se.log file to support@orbitalviews.com and we'll provide support and/or a key for a functional platform. All the best!

one_reviews_text:
EDIT:  Nov 2020 - No Change.  I'd say it has definitely been abandoned.  
This is an incredible view of the cosmos but too short for the money.

EDIT:  February 11th dev noted that more would be added in near future.  We're over two months later.....still no added content.  Abandoned?

I dropped my rating to three stars and will drop it a star for every month that new content isn't added.
review_feedback: Hi Double_Shot, we're doing our best to bring quality content at a reasonable price. More content is coming, it just requires time to make. If you're wondering, this upcoming content is an exploration of the Milky Way, highlighting the black hole at the center of our galaxy, as well as nebulae and star clusters. It will be included for everyone and will not be a DLC. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: You can see everything to scale in both size and distance (not usually feasible in physical space). You get to watch the Earth corkscrew around the Sun as it, too, shoots through space. You get to cross the Milky Way as a giant. Awesome
review_feedback: Thanks for your feedback!

one_reviews_text: I really hope they make more. Seeing the scale of the solar system in VR was mind blowing. As it zoomed out further I was more and more impressed. Ear to ear smile for the whole thing. When it got to the super far out nebulas and galaxies the detail wasnt great but overall its amazing and i cant wait for more.
review_feedback: Thanks: you gave us an ear to ear smile too :)

review_title: Steam version works, but not this one
one_reviews_text: Im using Quest 2 Link and app is stuck on a white loading screen. Thankfuly after a while of mailing with devs they provided steam key to me and that one works. Now this app just needs more contend.
review_feedback: Hi Laamamato, sorry you're experiencing problems with the Quest 2: we've had no problem with the Quest Link yet, but we'll grab a Quest 2 ASAP and try to reproduce the issue. In the meantime can you try uninstalling and reinstalling? Also, please send a mail to support@orbitalviews.com so we can assist you further. Thanks! The Overview team

one_reviews_text:
They have fixed the launch issues by the way. :)

This experience has changed my entire view of the cosmos and how we think of ourselves in regards to size.  This really puts into perspective how small we are, and how more than likely we are a part of something amazing at the "cosmic web" level.

For the devs:  Please release an update that allows zooming out at the cosmic web level.
review_feedback: Thanks for your support!

one_reviews_text: It's a pretty good experience. The unique aspect of this one is seeing the map of the known galaxies in The Beyond. There is little detail on the planets and their moons in our solar system, virtually none on the nebulas within our galaxy, no mention of the black hole at its center, nothing about the Andromeda galaxy. I think it's worth a few dollars if you have a kid or kids looking for an introduction to astronomy.
review_feedback: Thanks, our next educational activity will cover exactly this: various nebulae of our galaxy the Milky Way, and the Sagittarius A* black hole at its center! Stay tuned :)

one_reviews_text: Amazing app ok.. not so real the experience but anyway one of the most on the store... but I would have the italian language to feel better the experience. I don't understand everything in a different language. Please provide.
review_feedback: Hi, we do add languages (English, French, Chinese, German soon) but it is difficult to accomodate every culture :) Subtitles are an alternative: if you like you can help us to translate at least written text in Italian? If so, please contact us on www.overviewexperience.com

one_reviews_text: This App does not start, support please help!
review_feedback:
Hi markusner, our latest update should fix this problem! 
If it does, feel free to update your review. If not, please send us your Overview/system/se.log file at support@orbitalviews.com so we can investigate. Thanks from the Overview team!

one_reviews_text: Wish I could even get to see what I paid 10 bucks for, but it won't even launch.
review_feedback:
Hi althrin, our latest update should fix this problem! 
If it does, feel free to update your review. If not, please send us your Overview/system/se.log file at support@orbitalviews.com so we can investigate. Thanks from the Overview team!

one_reviews_text: Really, not much in it. All you get is a rather poorly made solar system, you get no informations on the planets, can´t zoom in much (Venus e.g. is but a yellow ball, when you move to close you just go through it. Every space map of the 20th century got more detailed planets. And you can´t do much with the program. Not even go into options menu to start another session. Got to quit and restart. Really, guys? Come on! And the graphic? What´s wrong with good resolution and nice graphic? It´s 2019!  Even Google Earth VR got a better image of the milkyway in the background.... and that´s not even their focus. No, i´ve seen way better programms. Don´t waste your money on this, it´s not... impressive.
review_feedback: Hi there. 'Overview' uses data from NASA and other space agencies to locate every asteroid, planet and star with their correct position, movement and appearance in real time. It is one of the most accurate representation of our universe to date. Can you please confirm that your PC supports the minimum requirements for running the software? As for the options, you can use your Rift controllers to go back to the menu and shift between activities. Let us know if this helps.

review_title: what a waste of money this is
one_reviews_text: all i can do is m ove towards or away from the earth!!! some moron prob desined the UX for VR on this as its not even worth the penny
review_feedback: Hi, there is much more content available in Overview: the activity you mention is designed to be an intro to 3D locomotion in space. The next activity already allows you to do much more. Could you try it, or the 30-min narrative Documentary taking you from Earth the edge of space?

one_reviews_text:
I'm a big fan of VR space apps, and I think I've tried most of them.  I enjoyed the content delivered here, and I'd recommend it to anyone who would enjoy a trip to a planetarium. 

An area where this experience could be improved is some of the animations.  While much of the experience is smooth (90fps), many objects moving through space seemed to be animated in a "choppy" way.  For example, some of the points of light (planets or stars, depending on "zoom" level) seemed to be orbiting their sun or passing by the viewer and it felt like they were being drawn at maybe 30fps with the rest of the environment was getting rendered at 90fps.
review_feedback:
Hi Audacity, glad you liked Overview. What was your favorite space experience in VR?

As for your feedback: thank you. The effect you mention may be related to different causes (software or hardware): could you share your PC settings with us at <support@orbitalviews.com>?

Happy to help you get the best experience as possible!

one_reviews_text: This could be better, but it was amazing...  I loved how you the journey and education took you from earth to the edge of what we think is the Universe.  I felt infnitesimal and was relieved to see earth again.  This could be better and I look forward to seeing more in the future.
review_feedback: We are glad you liked Overview. There will be more indeed: we are already working on the second content update. Our first update already included a Solar System discovery activity. The second one will include a Milky Way discovery activity. Stay tuned :)

one_reviews_text: inacurate information  and terrible animation  dont buy this product.
review_feedback: Hi Juangavioto, we're sorry you didn't like it. Overview received the "Best Education Experience" award from HTC Vive during GDC 2018, and it is based on data and imagery from space agencies including NASA and ESA. We are dedicating a lot of time and effort ensuring its visuals and animations are realistic and accurate. If you want to elaborate on what displeased you, please feel free to drop us a message at support@orbitalviews.com All the best for 2019 from the team!

one_reviews_text: Having used Space Engine before and that is one of the best software of all time and it´s free. So my expectiations was big. The tours was great. But of course you really want to explore the Universe the same way you can on the PC with Oculus Rift. I know that some peple had access to Space Engine and been able to use Oculus. I really hope this willbe possible again.

Worked perfectly First time through (All tours)

Subsequently, Saturns Rings have dissapeared, when in shadow,  Moon orbits, still seem to interact with rings, but rings not seen.

A Texture layer seems missing from nebuli!!!

Almost as if  Using NVIDA Fog, (Calculated z layer,) Whilst trying to implement  AMD Proper volumatic fog.  Or possible 32 bit to 24 bit shader conversion failure ?!?

Thanks for a truly fantistic experience !!!
review_feedback: Hi, thanks for your feedback and compliment! Could you send us your "system/se.log" file at support@orbitalviews.com so we can take a look?

one_reviews_text: Carl Sagan would be proud! Thanks for such an incredible experience.
review_feedback: You made our day :)

one_reviews_text: Stunning, relaxing and stimulating: the solar system is a common sight, but the visuals are great, and as soon as you leave the solar system it becomes incredible, the nebula and the galaxy look beautiful, you feel absorbed and so small... It's impressive to know that our galaxy which seems like the end of the world is actually just a small dot in the universe... So many topics i would like to see covered this way.
review_feedback: Thanks for your feedback!

one_reviews_text:
This is nowhere related to SpaceEngine where it is supposedly being a "SpinOff".
Seriously?? This is the worst experience since DK1 early tryouts. Why is there this ugly VGA Bitmap background? Where are the individually placed catalogue stars known from SE? Then: Nobody uses "Button A" these Days when you have the Trigger on Touch controller. This says it all for me. Best case very early Alpha Version. Poor. Shame on you! Rip off
review_feedback:
Hi Godam,

Thank you for your feedback.

It seems you are looking for a different program. OVERVIEW is a narrative experience with some interactive parts. It does not aim at being an exhaustive simulation of our universe. 

As the developer of SpaceEngine pointed out, we are partners in this adventure and all sales from OVERVIEW contribute to the development of his application. 

The more you help us making OVERVIEW successful, the faster you will see SpaceEngine being rolled out. 

Hope this helps. Please do not hesitate to adjust your review or contact us directly at contact@orbitalviews.com

Best,
The Overview team

one_reviews_text: I'm actually not sure if this is better than Titans of Space or not. Titans of Space was my first VR space experience so I'm a bit biased toward it. But despite a couple minor annoyances such as cutting out the sound between scenes and a few spots where the 3D doesn't merge correctly while zooming out, this is an amazing experience.

Exploring the solar system takes real effort. It takes ages trying to select a planet no matter how many times I click! Just about all I can do is use button B to turn off orbit trails. Not what I would call exploration. Frustrating, as I love Space Engine but if that's what this is based on there is no sign of it. No real star positions, just a static background. Could be so much better.
review_feedback:
Hi, it seems you're in the chapter that allows you to zoom in/out of the entire universe. 

If you want to explore the Solar System, you have to go to the activity "Explore the Solar System" where you can use the thumbstick to move around. Press A to zoom in when you are close to a planet, and you will be able to see it and its moons from up close.

If you're still facing trouble, please contact us.
If it helps, please let us know :)
